headline: Software companies are 'overly maligned,' analyst says
summary: Palantir (PLTR) reported fourth quarter earnings on Monday that beat Wall Street's expectations. DA Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the overall software sector, whether he thinks it will continue to struggle, and how Palantir fits into the space. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Software companies are 'overly maligned,' analyst says
content.description:
Palantir (PLTR) reported fourth quarter earnings on Monday that beat Wall Street's expectations.

DA Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the overall software sector, whether he thinks it will continue to struggle, and how Palantir fits into the space.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
content.summary: Palantir (PLTR) reported fourth quarter earnings on Monday that beat Wall Street's expectations. DA Davidson head of technology research Gil Luria joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the overall software sector, whether he thinks it will continue to struggle, and how Palantir fits into the space. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Palantir Stock Drops 14% as AI and Software Pull Back. It’s Having a Terrible 2026.
summary: Palantir Technologies  was one of the primary victims of Wednesday’s pullback in technology stocks.  Shares of the artificial-intelligence software leader dropped 14% to $136.52 on Wednesday, putting the stock on pace for its worst session since May 7, 2024, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Palantir stock rose 7% on Tuesday after the company disclosed higher fourth-quarter earnings and revenue than Wall Street expected.

content.title: Palantir Stock Drops 14% as AI and Software Pull Back. It’s Having a Terrible 2026.
content.summary: Palantir Technologies  was one of the primary victims of Wednesday’s pullback in technology stocks.  Shares of the artificial-intelligence software leader dropped 14% to $136.52 on Wednesday, putting the stock on pace for its worst session since May 7, 2024, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Palantir stock rose 7% on Tuesday after the company disclosed higher fourth-quarter earnings and revenue than Wall Street expected.

headline: Palantir Accenture Sovereign AI Push Tests Valuation And Growth Expectations
summary: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) is working with Accenture to build and scale sovereign AI data centers across EMEA. The collaboration focuses on AI infrastructure designed to meet stricter data security and sovereignty requirements in Europe and nearby regions. The partnership connects Palantir with other large technology providers including Dell and Nvidia as part of broader AI infrastructure efforts. For you as an investor, this development sits at the intersection of AI...
